item.title: Ukraine begins new negotiations after a sudden shakeup in Kyiv
item.description: Negotiations to end the war resume as Ukraine confronts internal turmoil and continued Russian strikes.

item.description: Afghans seeking asylum say they're stuck in a hellish limbo as all migration suspended to the U.S.

item.title: Airbus orders immediate repairs for 6,000 of its A320 family of jets
item.description: Aviation regulators have ordered urgent inspections of the Airbus A320 family of jets. The order follows a JetBlue plane's experience of an uncontrolled "pitch down" event last month.

item.title: Pope's visit to Lebanon sparks hope but also frustration
item.description: As Pope Leo prepares to visit northern Lebanon, Christian border villages in the south feel abandoned and struggle to rebuild after the war with Israel.

item.title: South Africans trapped on frontlines of Russia-Ukraine war plead for help
item.description: South Africa scrambles to rescue 17 men lured to fight for Russia in Ukraine, exposing a web of exploitation, politics and international mercenary recruiting involving a former president's daughter.

item.title: Zelenskyy's chief of staff resigns as Ukraine corruption investigations widen
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced the resignation of his powerful chief of staff, Andrii Yermak, whose residence was searched earlier in the day by anti-corruption investigators.

item.title: Pope Leo prays for unity at historic Nicaea site
item.description: On the second day of his inaugural overseas trip, Pope Leo XIV visited the ancient site of the First Council of Nicaea, in Turkey, urging Christians — and all faiths — to reject the use of religion to justify violence.

item.title: Death toll from floods and landslides in Indonesia tops 300
item.description: Improved weather helped rescuers on Indonesia's Sumatra island recover more bodies as they struggled to reach several areas that were hit by landslides and flash floods that left scores missing.
